intro: Consolida leptocarpa, commonly known as the slender scarlet runner. It is a species of flowering plant in the family Fabaceae, native to southern Europe and western Asia. The plant produces vibrant orange to red flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often hairy, while the stems are slender and branching. The seeds are enclosed in long, slender pods that split open when mature, releasing the seeds to the wind.
